poem:
### Fashion's Refrain

In the morning's light,  
denim whispers tight  
against legs unyielding.  
Oh, fickle thread,  
return of old seams  
clinging to forgotten  
desires. Time  
once more wraps  
us in fabric's echo,  
crisp yet worn  
like a caution,  
fashion in  
rebellion, history  
stitched anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Skinny jeans are showing signs of a comeback. Please make it stop | Dave Schilling If you’re reading this, there’s a good chance you are wearing clothes. Or my byline photo made you spontaneously strip down to nothing but a pair of crusty underwear and a smile. I don’t judge, and I also don’t blame you. That photo is from a decade ago. Assuming you’re in clothes, then you had to decide what to wear.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
